title: New deep learning technique paves path to pizza-making robots
content:
This article is part of our coverage of the latest in AI research. For humans, working with deformable objects is not significantly more difficult than handling rigid objects. We learn naturally to shape them, fold them, and manipulate them in different ways and still recognize them. But for robots and artificial intelligence systems, manipulating deformable objects present a huge challenge. Consider the series of steps that a robot must take to shape a ball of dough into pizza crusts. It must keep track of the dough as it changes shape, and at the same time, it must choose the right…

This story continues at The Next Web
description: A new deep learning technique developed by researchers shows promise to make robotics systems more stable in handling deformable objects.
